Lucas

(Sorry if the process for remarks to the new material design is supposed to be different than using the issues.)

I have just downloaded the 2.5beta2 version to try out the night mode, something I've been longing for for a while. In general, I really, really like the new material design and especially the night mode applying to the whole application - I see myself using it a lot. I also like the fact that it is so easy to switch between day and night modes. In general - thumbs up!

Now my remarks - the buttons' colors seem to be too vivid. For example, the 'plus' floating action button in the decks screen is blue, but the blue is too bright (for me). I would like the blue to be like the 'new' cards number or 'virtual' decks blue - more pastel. Similarly, I find the answer buttons too bright, especially the red 'again' button. The red and green used for the counters in top-left corner are softer and better fit the overall dark theme.

In the day mode, I think the status bar's blue is too bright as well, seems too distracting. I know I can use the night mode all the time, but I kind of prefer the day mode during the day, due to less contrast. In the same vein, I think the answer buttons are too distracting as well. I think the 'old' design had them white and only the texts were colored; the new design has the buttons colored, and somehow it doesn't fit it well.
title: Add ability to customize colors

body:
- Make sure that `New card position` is set to `Mix new cards and reviews` both in desktop Anki and in AnkiDroid and that both clients are in sync with AnkiWeb
- Go to `Settings > Reviewing` in AnkiDroid and change `New card position` to `New cards after reviews`
- Go back to deck list and sync AnkiDroid with AnkiWeb
- Sync desktop Anki with AnkiWeb
- Sync AnkiDroid with AnkiWeb
- Go back to `Settings > Reviewing`

You see that `New card position` has reverted to `Mix new cards and reviews`. The setting does not change in desktop Anki as expect it to.

I changed this setting in AnkiDroid about a week ago. Every day the setting kept its value while I was studying on the tablet (syncing AnkiDroid from time to time). In the evening I usually make changes to my decks in desktop Anki and the next day I notice the setting reverted on the tablet. This was fully reproducible during that time (and I never changed or even looked at desktop Anki preferences back then).

Today I tried changing this setting to various values on both sides to see how it behaves and sometimes it works as intended and sometimes not. For example I never managed to make it behave like this when changing setting in the other direction (i.e. from `New cards after reviews` to `Mix new cards and reviews`) or when changing it on the desktop rather than in AnkiDroid. I tried many times but the results were inconsistent. I think that's because some of client's or server's internal state has influence on this: which client synced last, whether each client thinks it needs to sync, whether it thinks its preferences have changed, etc. I can't see this state explicitly and I think that in some cases just checking it changes it (e.g. I noticed that just opening Anki desktop preferences makes it actually sync instead of just showing the `Processing...` popup). In the end I gave up and I can only say that the steps above produce this effect most of the time.

I think this affects other settings as well. For example from time to time I notice that `Next day starts at` gets reverted. I change it in AnkiDroid but after a while I notice that it has reverted again.

AnkiDroid debug info:
```
AnkiDroid Version = 2.5alpha58
Android Version = 5.1.1
ACRA UUID = aeee41c2-6522-4cb1-aaba-4cf0a8c6c06e
```

Anki:
```
Version 2.0.32
Qt 4.8.7 PyQt 4.11.4
```
title: Syncing with desktop Anki reverts settings changed in AnkiDroid

body:
This impacts people on devices with low memory or people who leave Anki running and come back after using several other apps. Basically anyone who often has Anki evicted out of memory by the system and then comes back to it.

It's tricky to repro naturally but Android provides a way to force it.

Steps to repro (on a device that has developer mode enabled)
1 Enable "don't keep activities" under developer options
2 Start studying in Anki (take note of what card you're on)
3 Open Settings (or open another app or just go back to the android home screen)
4 Go back to studying

Expected behaviour:

Anki should be on the same card it was on a minute ago.

Actual behaviour:

Anki's activity has been restarted without preserving state, you may be on a different card (if anki is randomising things) or just in a different state (e.g. you were on the answer screen now you're back on the question screen).

If you enable that dev setting and just use Anki normally, you'll notice lots of place where this occurs. I also end up reporting crashes when I enable this setting.

Adding onSaveInstanceState implementations in more Activity and Fragment classes will fix this.
title: AnkiDroid doesn't always handle destroy and restore of activity

body:
I have just tried a recent alpha build with the reworked UI (`2.5alpha55`). The new colors look really nice but there's one tiny feature I'm really missing. In the old color scheme when you pressed one of the rating buttons (`again`, `hard`, `good`, etc) or options from the top-right menu it was easy to see which one actually got activated. It was highlighted for a very short time before it took effect. In the new scheme it's still highlighted (I think) but there's very little contrast and it's harder to catch that in that brief moment. I wasn't even aware how much I relied on that until it was changed.

With touch it's not as easy to press the exact spot you want as it is with a mouse and I sometimes miss. The visual feedback was making me realize that quickly and I could undo the action. Now I'm often unsure and undo the card just in case.

I wonder if anyone else is experiencing this. I wasn't sure if it's actually worth reporting but I guess some feedback about the new UI won't hurt. It's really cool apart from that. I especially like the new, more compact deck list and that it's easier to unfold the nested decks now.
title: Too little visual feedback when pressing buttons/menu items

body:
[Android Marshmallow has removed the Apache HTTP client](https://developer.android.com/preview/behavior-changes.html#behavior-apache-http-client). 
Consequently, AnkiDroid doesn't compile with SDK 23.

The `useLibrary` workaround given by them did not appear to fix the broken import of `org.apache.http.HttpResponse`. 

I have no idea why that didn't work, but it's probably not a good idea to keep using it anyway. According to [this stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30556605/org-apache-http-httpentity-is-deprecated-how-to-solve-this-error-in-android-s):

> If you need to continue using the HttpClient API, consider switching to [OkHttp][2] and their HttpClient compatibility layer, or consider switching to [Apache’s separate Android edition of HttpClient][3]. Otherwise, switch to HttpURLConnection or OkHttp’s native API.

  [2]: http://square.github.io/okhttp/
  [3]: https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-client-4.3.x/android-port.html
title: Remove dependence on deprecated Apache HTTP client

body: As it currently stands, the Forecast statistic does not propogate previous performance trends when determining hypothetical future card loads.  E.g. if a user on average, and with small deviation, pushes 60% of the daily load at Hard, 20% at Good, and 10% Easy, and 10% Again; then forecast can easily intelligently anticipate card loads.  At present, it does not seem to do this at all, nor does it display the anticipated new daily alottment, and so Forecast is not useful at all for determining effective review-only periods over which one can reduce the daily card load.
title: Forecast Statistic not predictive

0" "deck list".

here" and Anki branding sounds quite challenging.

the logo on the side of the box? And something like "You have no flashcards"

Reported by `ospalh` on 2015-07-10 04:57:54
title: Special image for empty collection

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2684
```
Please explain your idea here.

It would be really nice to be able to shortly switch to a different app (eg, dictionary),
and be able to switch back to AnkiDroid without having to open the deck again. Right
now, it's impossible to look something up when editing a card. not only will it close
the editor, losing all changes without warning, there's even a good chance that when
re-entering the deck, a different card will appear, making it very hard to find the
card that was the reason for the app change. AnkiDroid is a great app already, but
this would really enhance its possibilities.

Is this feature available on similar apps (Anki Desktop, AnkiMobile,
AnyMemo, etc) ? If yes, it could help to include a screenshot or link to a
page explaining the feature.

```

Please explain your idea here.

The feature to mail off an exported apkg file is quite nice.
While a) most (some) of the time people will use it to mail it to themselves, and b)
when not they can type a message in the e-mail client, a bit of boilerplate¹ text would
be nice. Something like "Hi, This is a flashcard deck, send from AnkiDroid. Try importing
it into AnkiDroid or Anki vor desktop", with links to the two web sites, maybe a bit
more self-promotion.
The exact wording should probably be discussed in the forum.

Is this feature available on similar apps (Anki Desktop, AnkiMobile,
AnyMemo, etc) ? If yes, it could help to include a screenshot or link to a
page explaining the feature.

Web services that send automatic mails usually contain a bit of boilerplate. Look at
the last “your password was changed" or "you signed up at XYZ" mail. One case where
you get the chance to edit the text that still contains boilerplate is Firefox Hello
(their video chat). You click on "Mail link" or something, and you get some standard
text in your e-mail client.




¹ https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/boilerplate
```

Note: If this is your first time submitting an issue, please read the
following webpage:

https://ankidroid.org/docs/help.html


What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Have the phone set not to show sensitive notifications on the lock screen.
2. Start a sync.
3. Leave AnkiDroid as the forefront app.
4. Lock the phone.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

I suppose the "expected" behavior would be to somehow observe the notification.

When the sync finishes a notification is generated, but it can't be read because the
phone is hiding "sensitive" notifications. The notification can only be seen after
the phone is unlocked. However, when unlocking the phone the notification is already
cleared because AnkiDroid is the forefront app. The notification is never seen.

Not being able to see the notification means you don't know if the sync finished successfully
or not.

Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it
happen only one time?

It happens every time.

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2639
```
Note: If this is your first time submitting an issue, please read the
following webpage:

https://ankidroid.org/docs/help.html


What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Try to translate a cromulent German word like “Verkehrsinsel”¹² to, say Japanese³
with the multimedia editor and glosbe.com

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

You should get a simple message that no translation was found. (Or, although that that
is not happening is more of a glosbe.com problem, the correct translation).
Instead you get a “no translation” toast *and* a toast “Try using only lower case characters”


Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it
happen only one time?

Every time (when Java thinks the lower case string is different from the search string)

Paste the "debug info" from the AnkiDroid "About" dialog below (see the
above help webpage for detailed instructions).

Tried with AnkiDroid 2.5alpha35.
As this is “working as designed” i won’t bother with the debug info.

Please provide any additional information below.

For German “verkehrsinsel” rather than “Verkehrsinsel” is just wrong.
As another example, translating “Hürde”⁴ from German into Japanese worked, correctly,
translating the misspelled “hürde” yielded no result, correctly, too.

For languages that do capitalize their nouns the message should not be shown at all.
I am unconvinced that it is smart to show this even for languages that don’t. What
about proper nouns.

¹ https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verkehrsinsel
² that is, “traffic island”
² “安全地帯” or more literally “導流島” or “交通島” apparently. http://www.wadoku.de/search/Verkehrsinsel
⁴ hurdle or obstacle
```

body:

```
Currently Anki Desktop supports importing directly from the following formats:

Text separated by tabs or semicolons
Mnemosyne 2.0 deck (*.db)
Supermemo XML export (*.xml)
Pauker 1.8 Lesson (*.pau.gz)

These files (and therefore any format which can be first exported to plain text) can
therefore be imported indirectly by AnkiDroid using the sync feature (https://ankidroid.org/docs/manual.html#AnkiDesktop),
however some people without a computer may find it useful to be able to import these
directly into AnkiDroid.
```

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Ensure AnkiDroid and desktop are both in sync with ankiweb and that "start of next
day" hasn't yet occurred for the day.
2. Change "Start of next day" from a point in the future (i.e. later than now) to a
time in the past (i.e. earlier in the day than now)
3. Synchronize AnkiDroid as normal (observe: only ~3 KB uploaded, normal "Collection
Synchronized" message)
4. Attempt to synchronize Anki desktop, receive error "Your collection is in an inconsistent
state. Please run Tools>Check Database, then sync again"
5. Tools>Check database ("Database rebuilt and optimized", normal message)
6. Attempt to synchronize Anki desktop again, receive sync collision message (ie. full
sync forced)


What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Normal synchronization with no message about inconsistent collection state.

Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it
happen only one time?
Reproducible each time.

Paste the "debug info" from the AnkiDroid "About" dialog below (see the
above help webpage for detailed instructions).

AnkiDroid Version = 2.4.3
Android Version = 4.4.4
ACRA UUID = a8ca1a54-cb54-4800-862f-5b2954b35909

Please provide any additional information below.

1) Just to clarify the sequence, let's say that the "new day begins" is set to 20 hours
past midnight, it's currently 2 PM in your present locale, and the updated setting
is being set to 10.

2) Setting the start of next day from a point in the future to a point further in the
future (e.g. changing from 20 to 21 when it's currently 2 PM) does not seem to cause
any sync issues. 

3) Using Anki Desktop Version 2.0.32, MacOS 10.9.5 (current version of Anki desktop
as of this post)

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. I open a deck with cloze texts
2. When I come to a new card there's text field where I can insert the missing texts.
The cursor is in this text field automatically.
3. I tap on the text field and the keyboard pops up.
4. I enter the missing word.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The step 4 isn't necessary and annoying because I have to tap into the text field on
every single card you want to learn. This makes me loosing time. The keyboard should
pop up right away when a new card with cloze text is shown.

Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it
happen only one time?
It happens every time.

I saw this problem in other Android apps before, mainly dictionaries. Over the time
all the dictionaries I used have fixed this problem. When the search field is shown
the keyboard pops up automatically. There is no need anymore to tap into the text field.
I would like Ankidroid to behave this way too. 

I don't know whether there are Ankiusers who have very long cloze texts that would
be partly hidden by the keyboard. If this is the case I would be nice to have an option
in the settings where they can change the behavior of the keyboard to the old way so
that the keyboard doesn't pop up automatically. But the automatic pop up of the keyboard
should be the default behaviour.

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2536 ``` Hello and bonjour, I just bought a Galaxy Note 4 yesterday and the multitasking features on Anki are great! However I was disappointed to see that Anki wasn't on the list of apps when I cropped out a Tweet and wanted to make an Anki card about. Currently I'm getting by by adding to Evernote and making Anki cards when I get on a computer, it would be nice to cut out the middle man though ^^ I've attached pictures to explain what I'm talking about. The SPen has three relevant features to Anki. One is Smart Select, which is basically cropping out a part of the screen (what I used in the screenshot) and turning it into an image. The second is Image Clip, which is similar to Smart Select, but lets you crop your image in irregular shapes (e.g clouds or ovals), more useful for cropping images or comic books. The third is not as important, Screen Write. It takes a snapshot of your entire screen and lets you doodle on it, possibly useful for adding notes. I hope this isn't too much to ask for, I'm not sure how much effort this requires. But if you guys can do it then I'd be very grateful! Thank you and merci beaucoup. ``` Reported by `Spookane112` on 2015-02-20 21:01:27

body:

```
I would love if AnkiDroid allowed to have random flashcards that are due to review show
up in the notification bar periodically.

There's an Android app that seems to be doing this (although I have not tested it since
it says is incompatible with all my devices):
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.g2.quizification.lite


The idea would be to have the notification bar itself "test" me. It would be additionally
awesome if we could choose which sets to pull the cards from, set how often cards would
show up (i.e. "every x minutes"), and other options people might find useful.

I think this would be helpful for people like me who tend to "forget" to review their
cards or tend to "ignore" the notification for how many cards there are to review,
since there would be a question right there waiting to be answered, lowering the chance
for rationalizations like "I'll review later in the day" (it's these little things
that make a difference for chronic procrastinators like myself :P)
```

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2440
```
This is more of a question than a concrete suggestion.

In my Ankidroid installation i have 27000+ tiny files of sounds and images. Simply
copying onto the device already takes forever, but a bigger issue is that this also
impacts the device performance overall, since every android devices do not work very
well with directories that contain a lot of files. Any app that tries to touch the
ankidroid directory takes forever since it seems none of them are written in a manner
that they can deal well with giant directories, on top of the general slowness of the
android file system.

The one way i can think of resolving this would be to have ankidroid keep an sqlite
database of all the media files, instead of storing them straight on the hdd.

Would this be feasible at all?
```

Headline

line 1
line 2
... --- AnkiDroid displays this correctly. But whenever I edit and save such a note, even if I do not touch that particular field, each (insignificant) newline gets turned into another explicit line break, so I end up with double-spaced output: ---

Headline

Headline

line 1
line2

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2257
```
> Please explain your idea here.
Have buttons whose actions is configured by the user.
Currently this is available for gestures, 
but gestures are not available when using the whiteboard.

One Use case that needs this:
Draw CJK characters with cards that do not fit the screen, as it is the case with cards
that include enough info.
Whiteboard needs to be switched on and off frequently to scroll the cards; for instance
to look at a stroke order diagram or or to look at kanji composites. The button present
in 2.2 has been removed in 2.3 and this has made reviews extremely painful.

see discussion in 
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/anki-android/kCVim4Oq1bk


> Is this feature available on similar apps 
Available for Ankidroid's gestures though the actions currently do not include switching
the whiteboard on and off.

One way to implement this would be dedicated bar, with 4-5 buttons.
It's important that the buttons be always visible and actionable as any additional
click when multiplied by hundreds of reviews becomes a problem


```

I really like this feature a lot so dev suggested posting here instead on the reviews.
First time posting on Google code so be gentle on me please. (if there's issues with
the formatting just say so!)


Here are the problems/bugs that I've encountered during my use of anki with TTS :

Some times the menu of "Select language" pops up while at other times it doesn't. Figured
it out after a few reruns that it only pops one after the first fine selecting a particular
deck. If you go back later on the same deck it won't pop up again. No way to reset
the settings again...

At times the tts recites the front field and at times it doesn't (in the same deck),
I notice a lack of consistency here.

Since I only use basic and cloze notes, I can't say much to how the others will do.

The replay button just sometimes doesn't work (or lag  tremendously)

There also needs to be more custom options since you can have more than one type of
note in a single deck. I had cloze and basic together and the tts recited the cloze
fieldd before I put in my answer (which I don't really need). 

For users that have multiple TTS engines installed, there's a problem. The pop-up only
allows you to pick up one language for the moment (I had French and English TTS installed,
yet anki has only managed to pick up the one set which is active). I attempted to solve
the  problem by switching my main TTS to an English one but even after closing anki
and reopening it it shows "no text to speech language available". 
After switching or back to French it's still "no TTs language available".

Sometimes the tts speaks the HTML markup. Got really distraught right there!

I learn words from foreign language using Ankidroid.
Ankidroid feeds me with new words that I should memorize.
Also I often encounter new words in other contexts (articles, web sites, movies) that
I translate using dictionary and try to memorize.
Often new words from other context already in deck that I learn, but they too far away
from my current "learning window" and will appear when I completely forgot them.

to current "learning window", so that new cards will be learned not random, but from
real life context.

By HTML transformation I mean processing a card just before displaying it.
For instance adding kanji information, or transforming a FEN code into a table representing
a chess board.

The goal is to:
- Reduce the size of the AnkiDroid APK.
- Allow third-party developers to implement more transformations.
- Separate the release cycles of AnkiDroid and transformations.
- Simplify preferences.

I am not sure what is the best way to implement this, but it sounds possible:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23002072/delegate-text-transformation-to-plugin-android-apps-not-known-in-advance

Do we need to send anything to the plugins besides the source HTML?
```

emvau added basic Evernote App Integration.

As the code is a bit big, we probably won't merge it into AnkiDroid master, but it
would be great if it could be made into a plugin.

Any research on how the plugin system could work is very welcome!

Commit: https://github.com/emvau/Anki-Android/commit/975d5017336d6a18790a7f166aadb8fff041c2c0
Pull request: https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/pull/106

Requires the Evernote Android App!
Creates an anki note for every evernote note matching the Evernote search string specified
in the preferences. Doesn't synchronize contents but only the Evernote note ID. While
reviewing the anki notes the associated Evernote note will be opened in the Evernote
App. Tap the return key to get back to AnkiDroid and rate the difficulty.

!!! VERY EARLY STATE !!!

2nd try: now only one commit (rebase didn't work, so I created a new fork and made
all the changes again)

it only takes into account the number of cards under "learning", excluding the "young"
and "mature" ones.


You may have many young and mature cards due for a given day which you don't want to
do right now / have a specific time of the day you review them at (I have some sets
of cards I only review when doing endurance training), but you still want to learn
new cards. 
As the widget notification behaves now, it doesn't help with learning new cards as
long as you don't do all your review cards beforehand.
Giving the option to notify only when a specific number of learning cards (or some
combination of learning/young/mature) due is reached would increase ankidroid's usefulness
for learning new cards greatly for people how do their reviews at specific times of
the day.
```

```
When you study a deck that has sibling cards, and you set "New card order" to "New cards
in random order", Ankidroid does not put the CARDS in random order. Instead, it puts
the NOTES in random order, instead of the CARDS.

For example, this is what AnkiDroid considers to be "New cards in random order" at
the moment:

[Note_003] Card 1:   Q: Dollars |  A: $$$
[Note_003] Card 2:   Q: $$$     |  A: Dollars
[Note_001] Card 1:   Q: Pounds  |  A: £££
[Note_001] Card 2:   Q: £££     |  A: Pounds
[Note_002] Card 1:   Q: Yen     |  A: ¥¥¥
[Note_002] Card 2:   Q: ¥¥¥     |  A: Yen

As you can see, sibling cards ALWAYS follow one another. Only the note order has been
randomized.

What it should be showing (as in Anki desktop) is something like this:

[Note_003] Card 1:   Q: Dollars |  A: $$$
[Note_001] Card 2:   Q: £££     |  A: Pounds
[Note_002] Card 2:   Q: ¥¥¥     |  A: Yen
[Note_001] Card 1:   Q: Pounds  |  A: £££
[Note_003] Card 2:   Q: $$$     |  A: Dollars
[Note_002] Card 1:   Q: Yen     |  A: ¥¥¥

In other words, it isn't scrambling up the CARDS correctly. Only the NOTES.



>Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above?
I clean-reinstalled AnkiDroid several times to make sure. It's a problem with the software.

>What version of AnkiDroid?
2.0.2

>What version of Android?
2.3.7
```

If you're using the option to limit your reviews each day, then you're most likely using
it in a manner where you in fact DO all of your cards and ignore the artificial limit;
the limit really serves to keep morale up since you can only see a portion of the due
count at a time and not the whole pile. 

For people using the feature in this manner (most users I would think), it becomes
pointless because as soon as we hit the custom study option (which most users will)
to increase daily reviews, we see the total sitting right there. This is pointless/counterproductive
since we can peek at the total in other ways, and I feel this should be removed.

Thanks.
```

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1660
```
Currently, there are a number of places where we put together two internationalize strings,
for example:

"Undo %s" with "review" and "suspend card".

The problem with this is for localization the words "review" and "suspend card" might
be different depending on the context they appear in.

I would be better instead to have two strings:
  Undo review
  Undo suspend card
and possibly other strings where "review" and "suspend card" might be inserted, so
that translators can handle these better.
```

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1622
```
It was much handier in the previous versions of anki desktop and mobile that search
in browser was done as i typed. That allowed to easily search for many different versions
of one stem or word part in a short time - for example, i typed in "aus", then added
"ausz" and got results instantly, without pressing any button. Now when auto-search
has been turned off it is irritating to make an extra click on "search" button or "enter"
every time when searching a small variation of the word or word stem I am looking for.

I understood that this feature was turned off due to motivation to make the browser
faster for large collections, however in my collections of ~1000 entries it worked
perfectly. Therefore I propose to introduce an option to switch auto-search on or off.

```

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1601
```
On some devices, internal storage might be much faster than external storage. In that
case, a user might want to store the decks in the internal storage, which is currently
possible by changing the directory in which the decks are stored.

However, in that case, it is not possible to copy the decks out of internal storage
nor access the backups.

Probably backups should always be stored on the external storage and there could be
an option to copy from the internal to the external storage, probably as the export
feature offered by Anki 2 on the desktop.
```

```
Implement onLowMemory and onTrimMemory

These methods are called when the OS needs memory, and AnkiDroid is in great danger
of being killed, which makes user experience bad (example: user is reviewing Japanese,
email arrives, user checks email quickly then comes back to review, but AnkiDroid has
died and must reload and open database, which takes time).

When called, we should do whatever we can to reduce the size of the memory AnkiDroid
is using. Memory can be seen with "adb shell procrank". That probably means emptying
caches. Anything else we could do to momentarily reduce used memory?

By the way, has anyone studied what takes memory in AnkiDroid? It seems that AnkiDroid
is quite heavy so it gets killed quite often.
```

```
As reported on the Anki forums, if the internal memory or SD card are on a VFAT partition,
there's a limit of about 12k files in a folder, and attempts to write more than that
many files fail. Most desktop users are on NTFS/HFS+/EXT3+ which all scale to that
many files fine, and as iOS also uses HFS+, this issue seems to be limited to old desktops
on VFAT and AnkiDroid.

Perhaps the easiest solution is to provide an option to save the files in a zip and
extract them when they're first referenced on a card, leaving them there. That would
minimize extra writes compared to removing them after a card is displayed. Storing
them in lots of subfolders seems a much more complicated solution: you wouldn't be
able to rely on the html <base> tag for media any longer, and it would make it considerably
harder for users to know which folder media is located in.

Forum thread for reference: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/ankisrs/vrvELhL5V4M

```

Forvo is a collaborative effort to record native people speaking all words.

It could be used for a given card, if this card's word (or sequence of words) is present
in the Forvo database.
They don't have only words, but expressions and small sentences too. See for instance:
http://www.forvo.com/search/de%20rien/

At first use, the user would be prompted for her own API key (free to get on Forvo
website).

User could choose to either:
- always use the highest rated recording
- use a random recording, to train at recognizing the word rather than train at recognizing
the sound

The entire feature would be an opt-in option, as some people could object to the high
bandwidth usage.
```

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1072
```
The master of AnkiDroid currently contains proprietary code, so it can not strictly
be called Open Source.

The proprietary blobs are the Zeemote jars:
https://github.com/nicolas-raoul/Anki-Android/tree/master/libs

I attach the Zeemote EULA, you can see it is very restricted. Of course, the source
code of the jars is not open source, it is not even distributed.

Why it is a problem:
- Using only Open Source is important for many people.
- Including a proprietary blob with unknown source is a security risk.

We might have to remove Zeemote support because of that.
An optimist view could be to hope that an open source driver will be released.

Meanwhile, only the nobluetooth branch is strictly Open Source.
```

Another good enhancement would be to have the possibility to browse through a variation
starting from or leading to a given FEN position. Each (highlighted?) half move may
be specified as a separate attribute of an infinite list of attributes or as a unique
complex attribute. If the variation start from the given position you just browse through
it straightforward, else if the variation leads to the given position you have to browse
it backward.

For instance:
Variation: 7. Bg5 h6 8. Bxf6 Nxf6
Separated attributes: [fen move1=Bc1-g5 move2=h7-h6 move3=Bg5-f6 move4=Nd7-f6 startingfrom=true|false]...[/fen]
Single attribute: [fen variation=Bc1-g5,h7-h6;Bg5-f6,Nd7-f6 startingfrom=true|false]...[/fen]

This way you would implement a rather complete chess interface available for our cards
:-)
```

Reported by `resta.andrea` on 2012-01-06 15:44:14
title: Chess FEN viewer: variation browsing

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 934
```
It would be a good improvement to highlight the last move played in a chess position,
as it may be relevant to many kind of questions or simply a further detail.
It may be implemented by simply coloring the starting and target square borders and
it may be specified as a fen tag attribute, such as:
[fen lastmove=Re1-e8]...[/fen]

Please note I explicitly specified the starting square too and I don't think there
is a better way to do it, as standard algebraic chess notation is unambigous only if
you refer to the starting position, not the final one. For instance, if we want to
move a rook to e4 but both rooks of ours, placed in e1 and e8, could do it we have
to specify also the starting row of the rook, so if the rook we want to move is the
one in e1 we simply write R1e4. If the our rooks are placed in the same row, we obviously
use the column to distinguish them. For instance, Rae4 if we have a rook in a4 another
one in g4 and we want to move the former to e4. It's easy to understand this notation
stops working if we refer to the final position. If it's not ambigous it's enough to
write Re4. But where did it start from??

I'd simply write both starting and target squares: lastmove=Ra4-e4.
```

Support for use of a Zeemote during reviews was added in version 0.7, and I have recently
used it and found it quite useful.  In order to make it even more useful and appealing
to other users, I would like to suggest some expanded functionality...

The current implementation allows for use of three keys on the Zeemote for four functions
within AnkiDroid A=Good; B=Again; D=Easy; any of A,B,D=Show Answer.
This item is to track the request to add additional functions, and allow the user to
map the functions to keys of the Zeemote.  
Suggest new functions and default mappings of buttons/joystick might be:
During Reviews
  D = Next Card (allow user to separate this button from the answer buttons to prevent
inadvertent presses)
  JSdown = Again
  JSleft = Hard (Review) / Good (New)
  JSup = Good (Review) / Easy (New)
  JSright = Easy (Review) / Very Easy (New)
  B = Replay audio (replays question audio if answer not yet shown, replays answer
audio if answer shown)
  C = Undo
  A = Back (exit reviews & return to deck picker)
When at deck picker
  JSup/JSdown =  Scroll up/down deck picker list with joystick up/down
  D = Select (a deck to review with D button)

Other Recommendations
  Connect to Zeemote sooner – e.g. when AnkiDroid starts up so do not need to reconnect
with each deck, and to allow use of Zeemote for selecting a deck from deck picker
  Warn with Zeemote Battery hits XX threshold – in my view, probably the lowest priority
of the bunch
  Allow the user to re-map the functions above to different keys and/or joystick positions.

```

Every once in a while, a user in the Market explains that AnkiDroid corrupted their
deck. That is a very negative experience for users.

While fighting the root cause is essential, this root cause can not be totally eliminated
because causes are external, see http://ankisrs.net/docs/DeckErrors.html#_causes
So fixing deck errors is important too.

Present solution:
Install sqlite3 and run the following on the command line:
http://ankisrs.net/docs/DeckErrors.html#_causes

Enhanced solution 1:
The present solution is too complex for most phone users.
My enhancement suggestion would be a web application to fix decks.
It would have a file upload dialog to input the deck, and would allow to download the
fixed deck.
Maybe it can be implemented on Google AppEngine?

Enhanced solution 2:
Maybe it is possible to fix the deck directly within AnkiDroid? As a "DeckRepairer"
activity or something.
```

```
a kind of music player that selects tracks from an Anki deck's media folder, and shows
them based on their difficulty (more difficult=more often). It would open the .anki
database read-only.

Idea by Rachels:
Recently I've made a new deck for some of my mp3 listening material.  The question
is a track name and the answer contains a longish -  audio track.  I've been using
it  for the audio from 'Ultimate Japanese Phrasebook' plus a few other audioblog or
dialogues type tracks. Each track is them marked again, hard, easy or very easy depending
on how soon or how often I think I need to review it.  I wouldn't do this in desktop
anki, as i don't want to spend too much time sitting in front of a computer, but with
ankidroid being mobile, combining an mp3 player with some filtering of tracks so that
the easiest ones go away and the newest or hardest ones are repeated seems to make
sense. I've been happy with this so far.
The is already a feature request for track pausing and rewind. These are the basics
features that need to be added for it to be really practical.
But if it were to be popular, there could be more complex features added to make it
perfect for language study.
1. Looping track without having to reach into the pocket and press replay
2. Press a button to loop over the last eg 10 sec for bits that are not understood
well.
3. Playback at 70%, 80% and 90% normal speed, ideally without affecting pitch. (There
are players that can do this on android).
```

Reported by `john.mg.allen` on 2010-07-04 18:03:37
title: Audio sometimes doesn't play

body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 93
```
It would be great if one could easily suspend / unsuspend all cards in a
deck with audio in the Android version of Anki.  The logic is that
AnkiDroid is portable, and therefore used in a variety of environments -
some not conducive to audio.
When in a quiet room where the user can hear audio, and where audio would
not disturb others, one would prefer that all cards of a category be in the
same deck, and audio cards would be mixed in with recall and visual
recognition cards.
However, users will often want to use AnkiDroid on a loud train, or in a
quiet library where audio cards are not helpful.  It would be nice if one
could simply suspend any card that plays audio for those occasions where it
is not convenient, and un-suspend when the location is more suited for audio.
Of course one could turn down the audio and fail the cards, but that
defeats the learning algorithms.  I don't know how the community at large
feels about headphones, but I for one don't like to carry them everywhere I
go...whereas I do carry my Droid everywhere, and use AnkiDroid for a few
minutes here and there as I'm able.
```

body:
Hi,

This is a small PR that adds the ability for users to specify a custom SYNC_BASE url in the preferences. The default is the https://ankiweb.net/ URL.

Would anyone have a suggestion as how to replicate the functionality I added in AndroidApp.getApplicationPrefs() so it may not be necessary?

This also does not verify if the given URL ends with a slash. It is currently left to the user to format this url properly.
title: Added support for custom Anki Server URL (SYNC_BASE).

http://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/issues/detail?id=2152
https://ankiweb.net/shared/info/1417170896
